name: PHILADELPHIA ENTERTAINMENT AND DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS, L.P., d/b/a Foxwoods Casino Philadelphia, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Department of Licenses and Inspections of City of Philadelphia, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Philadelphia Entertainment & Development Partners, L.P. v. City of Philadelphia

pin_cites.parenthetical: discussing the application of the Court's King's Bench powers
discussing the application of the Court's King's Bench powers

parties: PHILADELPHIA ENTERTAINMENT AND DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS, L.P., d/b/a Foxwoods Casino Philadelphia, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Department of Licenses and Inspections of City of Philadelphia, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 16th day of October, 2007, it is hereby ordered that Petitioner’s above-referenced application for exercise of King’s Bench jurisdiction is dismissed without prejudice. Pennsylvania Gaming Control Board v. City Council of Philadelphia, (“PGCB v. City Council”) 593 Pa. 241, 928 A.2d 1255 n. 6 (2007) (discussing the application of the Court’s King’s Bench powers). It is also hereby ordered that Petitioner’s above-referenced application for a temporary stay is dismissed as moot.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
934 A.2d 1158
PHILADELPHIA ENTERTAINMENT AND DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS, L.P., d/b/a Foxwoods Casino Philadelphia, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA and Department of Licenses and Inspections of City of Philadelphia, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 16, 2007.
